p: Interestingly, wintergreen ( Gualtheria fragrantissima) essential oil, which was dominated by methyl salicylate (99.7%), showed antileishmanial activity against both L. amazonensis promastigotes (IC 50 20.7 μg/mL) and amastigotes (IC 50 22.2 μg/mL). Betula lenta (birch bark) essential oil (99.9% methyl salicylate) was somewhat less active against L. amazonensis promastigotes (IC 50 32.2 μg/mL). Considering the abundance of methyl salicylate in both wintergreen and birch essential oils, this compound is likely the active component.
